DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date a predetermined set of questions about a Positron Emission Tomography (PET) facility have been completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A quality, ability, or accomplishment that makes a digital Positron Emission Tomography (PET) device suitable for an imaging task._Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._A predetermined set of questions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

Property.preferredDefinition: Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The place in time that any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic  happens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Time meaning: Like time, date, frequency, occurence,..etc

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.
Something that happens at a given place and time.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/30/10 removed "Manually_curated" from definition.  7/16/08 - updated to include qualifers used in long name.  released for use in UofWash study.  3/16/07 - created to support the 10 character ACRIN date fields which include the '/'.
